reviews.review: the unit cost $ 275 to start with , so it is not worth repairing .
going from acer 15 to acer 11 was difficult , 11 inches seems too small for me .
also it ' s not a true ssd drive in there but emmc , which makes a difference .
the computer has difficulty switching between tablet and computer .
2 / 28 / 18 - a couple days ago i updated the chrome os .
it ' s just that chrome doesn ' t work the same with a chromebook as it does with windows .
hopefully in 10 years they ' ll have this figured out and it won ' t suck so badly .
bought this last year on july .
i rarely use the keyboard .
- great price for a touchscreen chromebook
it is glitchy , and barely usable .
i ordered one , the touch pad failed to work consistently .
i often find i ' ve typed an entire sentence ( or more ) with my fingers on the wrong keys , which is very unproductive when trying to take real - time notes in a meeting !
i know it only takes a few seconds , but a new device should not be doing this and makes me question if it ' ll get worse in the future .
i also have to press the trackpad very hard for left click ( not as badly as the first unit , though ) , and i lost right click functionality on the track pad 2 days into my voyage with this thing .
i tried factory resetting after i updated the os , and it still drained 9 % over 8 hours .
hdmi out doesn ' t work right .
they had it over a week and then shipped back .
i was excited to receive this chromebook , only to watch that excitement dissipate within mere hours as i noticed the touchscreen did n ' t work at all on tablet mode .
clearly there is some kind of major defect here that acer has n ' t resolved .
i bought this for my daughter to use to take online classes while she ' s overseas in europe for a year .
decent sound quality .
flimsy power adapter .
wi - fi slows down to crowl and speeds back up intermittently .
regret buying it at times .
it just turned off and will not turn back on .
the product is great , but the customer support is horrible .
called support a second time after 10 minutes of verifying some type of info they told me to call google without even trying to help .
but i ' m getting into photography now , and it ' s terrible for loading , storing , and editing pictures .
i have sent it in twice already and waiting for it to come back .
the screen looked great .
no matter how many times i reinserted the charging adapter , i kept getting this message .
i had no option but to shut down the computer , unplug it , plug it back in , and then reboot .

reviews.review: the screen flashes for a second every 30 seconds or so .
i noticed the battery went down to 67 % for no reason .
works good but the fan kicks in pretty often , which is to keep the laptop cool but the sound is annoying .
nano edge display is nice .
everything was fine and i went out for an hour .
the audio is almost impossible to hear .
it is slow to do everything .
here ' s the kicker : it is doing a terrible job running dragon age .
it doesn ' t has backlit keyboard : ( typing in low light is such a pain .
very disappointed in how slow it seems .
keyboard and mouse pad seem fine , but overall it seems strangely slow .
i have been using this for just 3 months .
crazy keypad : this issue is even worse .
overall , the laptop has a solid feel to it .
this lead me to believe that although i purchased a “ new ” product , they sent me a refurbished one instead .
i ' m out from us , i live in colombia , and maybe i can not return these laptop .

i like the speed , the processor the hybrid storage units ( 128ssd and 1tera ) , but the web cam sucks , really poor resolution and the keyboard doesn ' t have the numerical part and the caps lock or num lock don ' t have any light or guide to help you .
pred: the caps lock or num lock

reviews.review: lightweight .
yesterday the backlight went out .
it was brand new out of the box , i ' ve never dropped it .
now i have to deal with warranty stuff and sending it back etc .
ram upgrade available
hard drive upgrade available
i had issues with the touchpad sticking or not responding to click correctly from the start .
it ' s still a mainly functional computer , but using it is just not the greatest .
we ' ve had the computer for 5 weeks , used it a total of less than 20 hours , and now it will be gone for 3 weeks .
i send it to asus warranty and now after a week they ' re sending it back stating the no problem was found .
display stop working within 2 months .
since it came with no user manual , i had to call asus customer support and got someone who knew all about windows 10 software but nothing about my asus notebook .
after reading all the bad reviews , just sent it back for a refund .
all over this asus laptop which has a non - functioning touchpad .
my screen broke when just putting a textbook on it .
don ' t even bother calling customer support , in my experience , they do you no good .

reviews.review: keyboard needs to be redesigned entirely .
6 ` ` screen is big enough to read with ease , yet the item itself is light enough to tote to meetings .
so far , this looks as if it meets my needs as a good ` ` work machine . ` `
after exactly one year of useage this computer completely stopped working .
it boots up in 10 seconds and shuts down in 2 to 3 seconds .
i like the idea that the keyboard lights up and has a ` ` time out ` ` feature to shut off .
it seems put together well .
what they lack in size , they make up for in raw speed , durability , and energy efficiency .
+ decent quantity of available ports
+ it has a dvd drive : o
- it runs hot !
running grid benchmark , it got to a high 92 / 93 degrees c !
- new i5 mobile processor .
- ddr4 ram that is upgradable .
- very decent battery life .
so far i am pleasantly impressed with this unit , however i have not used it a long time or tested many applications to date .
i can certainly say this is the best laptop i ' ve ever had ( but then again i ' ve only had 3 , and you would expect these things to improve over time , right ) .
